item.title: Shortcuts of the old and minimalist
item.description: As I get older and grumpier, I increasingly value clean, uncluttered working environments. I’m sure I’m not the only one, so here’s a few useful practices and shortcuts that help me avoid using the mouse and satisfy my need for productivity micro-optimisation. They are mainly for macOS users. Hide everything Adjust your system preferences to automatically hide the Dock and menu bar (there’s a checkbox in “General”). With these two changes, a maximised window is effectively full-screen.
